channel.title: Hyperion?
channel.description:
I downloaded Hyperion by Skully and I get this as error when running
[code=java]Aug 28, 2010 4:32:20 PM org.hyperion.Server main INFO: Starting Hyperion... Aug 28, 2010 4:32:20 PM org.hyperion.rs2.model.GameObjectDefinition init INFO: Loading definitions... Aug 28, 2010 4:32:20 PM org.hyperion.fileserver.FileServer bind INFO: Binding to port : 43595... Aug 28, 2010 4:32:20 PM org.hyperion.fileserver.FileServer bind INFO: Binding to port : 8080... Aug 28, 2010 4:32:20 PM org.hyperion.fileserver.FileServer start INFO: Ready Aug 28, 2010 4:32:20 PM org.hyperion.rs2.RS2Server bind INFO: Binding to port : 43594... Aug 28, 2010 4:32:20 PM org.hyperion.rs2.ScriptManager <init> INFO: Loading scripts... Aug 28, 2010 4:32:20 PM org.hyperion.rs2.RS2Server start INFO: Waiting for pending background loading tasks... Aug 28, 2010 4:32:22 PM org.hyperion.rs2.model.GameObjectDefinition init INFO: Loaded 25374 object definitions. Aug 28, 2010 4:32:22 PM org.hyperion.rs2.model.ItemDefinition init INFO: Loading definitions... Aug 28, 2010 4:32:22 PM org.hyperion.Server main SEVERE: Error starting Hyperion. java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: org.hyperion.cache.InvalidCacheExceptio n: No index files present. at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerGet(Unknown Source) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(Unknown Source) at org.hyperion.util.BlockingExecutorService.waitForPendingTasks(Blockin gExecutorService.java:50) at org.hyperion.rs2.RS2Server.start(RS2Server.java:74) at org.hyperion.Server.main(Server.java:36) Caused by: org.hyperion.cache.InvalidCacheException: No index files present. at org.hyperion.cache.Cache.<init>(Cache.java:75) at org.hyperion.rs2.model.ObjectManager.load(ObjectManager.java:44) at org.hyperion.rs2.model.World$2.call(World.java:125) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(Unknown Source) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(Unknown Source ) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
I know your supposed to add a cache but where specifically? I got a client working though so :) but I need the source to work :(

@Cres wrote:

wait , you mean uploading your cache?

item.title: Hyperion?
item.dc:creator: @Exorth1 Exorth
item.description:
@Exorth1 wrote:

I downloaded Hyperion by Skully and I get this as error when running

Aug 28, 2010 4:32:20 PM org.hyperion.Server main INFO: Starting Hyperion... Aug 28, 2010 4:32:20 PM org.hyperion.rs2.model.GameObjectDefinition init INFO: Loading definitions... Aug 28, 2010 4:32:20 PM org.hyperion.fileserver.FileServer bind INFO: Binding to port : 43595... Aug 28, 2010 4:32:20 PM org.hyperion.fileserver.FileServer bind INFO: Binding to port : 8080... Aug 28, 2010 4:32:22 PM org.hyperion.rs2.model.GameObjectDefinition init INFO: Loaded 25374 object definitions. Aug 28, 2010 4:32:22 PM org.hyperion.rs2.model.ItemDefinition init INFO: Loading definitions... Aug 28, 2010 4:32:22 PM org.hyperion.Server main SEVERE: Error starting Hyperion. java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: org.hyperion.cache.InvalidCacheExceptio n: No index files present. at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerGet(Unknown Source) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(Unknown Source) at org.hyperion.util.BlockingExecutorService.waitForPendingTasks(Blockin gExecutorService.java:50) at org.hyperion.rs2.RS2Server.start(RS2Server.java:74) at org.hyperion.Server.main(Server.java:36) Caused by: org.hyperion.cache.InvalidCacheException: No index files present. at org.hyperion.cache.Cache.<init>(Cache.java:75) at org.hyperion.rs2.model.ObjectManager.load(ObjectManager.java:44) at org.hyperion.rs2.model.World$2.call(World.java:125) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(Unknown Source) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(Unknown Source ) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Press any key to continue . . .

I know your supposed to add a cache but where specifically? I got a client working though so but I need the source to work
